meanings.definition: The state or condition of being impossible.
meanings.sent1: The impossibility of flying without wings amazed the children.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained the impossibility of time travel to the students.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the impossibility of pulling a rabbit out of a hat twice.
meanings.sent4: The athlete faced the impossibility of breaking the world record in just one day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the concept of impossibility clear with a simple experiment.

meanings.sent1: The treasure hunt seemed like an impossibility to the young explorers.
meanings.sent2: The rescue mission faced the impossibility of reaching the stranded climbers in time.
meanings.sent3: The cat trying to catch its own tail was an amusing impossibility to watch.
meanings.sent4: The dream of becoming a mermaid felt like an impossibility to the little girl.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle was an impossibility until the missing piece was found.
